# Proyeksi 2025

# Pre-Sales

Perseroan menetapkan target pre-sales tahun 2025 sebesar Rp11.017,0 miliar, mencerminkan pertumbuhan yang flat (flat growth) dari pengapaian yang kuat pada tahun 2024. Strategi Perseroan masih akan tetap fokus pada diversifikasi geografis melalui model bisnis kerja sama operasi yang efektif untuk mengembangkan projek-proyek di seluruh Indonesia. Selain itu, Perseroan akan tetap Berkonsentrasi pada Produk perumahan dengan target utama segmen menengah atas dan segmen di atasnya dan pengguna akhir (end-user) sebagai pendorong utama. Inisiatif strategis ini akan memerkitut ketahanan Perseroan di tengah kondisi pasar yang terus Berkembang. Selenjutnya pre-sales diharapkan akan mendapatkan manfaat dari kelanjutan insentif PPN DTP. Oleh karena itu, Perseroan kembali menerapkan strategi percepatan konstruksi untuk menc Gatkan pasokan (supply) yang memenuhi kriteria dan menargetkan pre-sales senilai minimum Rp2.000,0 miliar dari tambahan unit ini.

# Pendapatan

Dengan pencapaian kinerja keuangan terbaik di tahun 2024, Perseroan kembali menargetkan pencapaian kinerja keuangan tertinggi sepanjang mata di tahun 2025. Perseroan mengusahakan pertumbuhan pendapatan  $5\% -10\%$  secara year-on-year (yoy), yang akan difontribusikan oleh segmen pengembangan properti (residencial) dan properti investasi (komersial). Di segmen pengembangan properti, Perseroan Selama menjadi tahun tersebut telah secara konsisten memimpin pencapaian kinerja pre-sales di industrii properti. Dengan eksekusi yang telah terbukti, Perseroan secara efektif menerjemahkan pre-sales yang kuat ini ke dalam kinerja keuangan yang nyata. Selain itu, Perseroan juga secara konsisten melakukanerah terima seksuai Jadwal dan dengan standar kualitas yang tinggi. Di samping itu, segmen properti komersial akan terus mencapat melalui optimalisi aktif untuk memaksimalkan potensinya.

Perseroan juga mengantisipasi ekspansi margin pada tahun 2025, yang akan didorong oleh pengakuan pendapatan dari Produk residenial dengan margin yang lebih tinggi dalam projek-proyek Unggulan,seperti CitraLand Surabaya.

# Laba Bersih

Dengan adanya perkiraan peningkatan pendapatan, Perseroan menargetkan pertumbuhan laba bersih sekitar  $10\% - 15\%$  yoy.

# Struktur Modal

Kebijakan struktur modal Perseroan pada tahun 2025 tidak mengalami perubahan. Perseroan masih menargetkan rasio utang bersih terhadap ekuitas maksimum 0,3x.

# 2025 Projections

# Pre-Sales

The Company has set a pre-sales target for 2025 of Rp11,017.0 billion, reflecting flat growth compared to the strong performance in 2024. The Company's strategy will continue to focus on geographic diversification through an effective joint operation business model to develop projects across Indonesia. Additionally, the Company will remain focused on residential products targeting the upper-middle and higher market segments, with end-users as the main drivers. This strategic initiative will strengthen the Company's resilience amidst a continuously evolving market. Furthermore, pre-sales are expected to benefit from the continuation of the VAT Incentives (PPN DTP). Therefore, the Company will implement a construction acceleration strategy to increase the supply of qualifying products, targeting pre-sales of a minimum of Rp2,000.0 billion from these additional units.

# Revenue

With the best financial performance achieved in 2024, the Company is targeting a record-high financial performance for 2025. The Company aims for a revenue growth of  $5\% -10\%$  year-on-year (yoy), which will be contributed by the property development (residential) and investment property (commercial) segments. In the property development segment, the Company has consistently led the industry in pre-sales performance over the past few years. With proven execution, the Company has effectively translated strong pre-sales into tangible financial performance. Additionally, the Company consistently delivers on schedule and at high-quality standards. The commercial property segment will continue to grow through active optimization to maximize its potential.

The Company also anticipates margin expansion in 2025, driven by revenue recognition from higher-margin residential products in key projects such as CitraLand Surabaya.

# Net Income

With the expected increase in revenue, the Company targets a net profit growth of around  $10\% - 15\%$  yoy.

# Capital Structure

The Company's capital structure policy for 2025 remains unchanged. The Company is still targeting a maximum net debt-to-equity ratio of  $0.3x$ .

# Kebijakan Dividen

Perseroan tidak melakukan perubahan kebijakan dividien di tahun 2025. Pembagian dividen masih akan mempertimbangkan perolehan laba, kondisi keuangan, kebutuhan operasional, dan kebutuhan ekspansi.

# Prospek Usaha

Perseroan munches target-bisnis untuk tahun 2025 dengan mempertimbangkan prospek usaha properti pada tahun 2025 yang diperkurakan akan terus menuunjukkan pertumbuhan yang positif, seiring dengan mencakup perumahan, kawasan industri, dan perkantoran, telah mencapai Rp122,9 trilium pada tahun 2024. Angka ini menempatkan sektor properti di peringkat 4 (empat) sudah dari 23 (dua puluh tiga) subsektor, menuunjukkan perananya yang sangat penting dalam perekonomian Indonesia. Capaian ini juga melampaui realisi investasi pada tahun 2023 yang tercatasebesar Rp115,2 trilium, mengindikasikan adanya tren positif yang terus berlanjut.

Peningkatan investasi di bisnis properti ini mencerminkan optimism相对较hitap potensi sektor properti di Indonesia, terutama dalam pengembangan perumahan dan kawasan industri yang telah memiliki permintaan yang tinggi. Seiring dengan pertumbuhan ekonomi yang stabil dan semakin Berkembangnya infrastruktur di berbagai daerah, permintaan akan hunian, ruang perkantoran, dan kawasan industri diperkirakan akan terus mencgetat. Selain itu, Pemerintah yang terus mendukung sektor ini melalui kebujakan investasi yang menarik,seperti insentif bagi pengembangan kawasan industri dan perumahan, turut menjadi faktor pendorong yang signifikan dalam menjaga momentum pertumbuhan properti.

Ke depan, sektor properti Indonesia diharapkan akan terus tumbuh, terutama didorong oleh kebutuhan hunian yang semakin tinggi seiring dengan urbanisasi yang terus berlangsung. Selain itu, dengan semakin bergembangnya sektor e-commerce dan digitalisasi, permintaan untuk ruang perkantoran dan pusat logistik diperkurakan akan menc Gat, mendukung tambuhnya sektor properti komersial. Dengan pencapaian investasi yang terus menc Gat dan tren positif dalam permintaan pasar, prospek usaha properti pada tahun 2025 tampaknya sangat menjanjikan, memberikan peluang bagi pengembang dan investor untuk terus bergambang dan berinovasi dalam menghadapi dinamika pasar yang terus berubah.

# Dividend Policy

The Company will not change its dividend policy in 2025. Dividend distribution will continue to be based on profit earnings, financial condition, operational needs, and expansion requirements.

# Business Prospects

The Company has formulated its business targets for 2025 by considering the business outlook of the property sector, which is expected to continue showing positive growth in 2025, in line with the increasing investment in this sector. Based on data from the Ministry of Investment and the Investment Coordinating Board (BKPM), realized investment in the property subsector, which includes housing, industrial estates, and office space reached Rp122.9 trillion in 2024. This figure places the property sector among the top 4 (four) out of 23 (twenty-three) subsectors, highlighting its crucial role in Indonesia's economy. This achievement also surpasses the 2023 investment realization of Rp115.2 trillion, indicating a continuing positive trend.

The increase in property business reflects the market's optimism toward the potential of Indonesia's property sector, particularly in housing and industrial estate development, which continue to show strong demand. Alongside stable economic growth and the expansion of infrastructure across various regions, the demand for residential units, office spaces, and industrial areas is projected to remain strong. Additionally, Government support through favorable investment policies, such as incentives for industrial estate and housing development, continues to serve as a significant driver in maintaining the property sector's growth momentum.

Looking ahead, Indonesia's property sector is expected to continue growing, primarily driven by the increasing demand for housing in line with ongoing urbanization. In addition, with the rapid development of the e-commerce sector and digitalization, the demand for office space and logistics centers is projected to rise, supporting the growth of the commercial property segment. With increasing investment achievements and a positive trend in market demand, the business outlook for the property sector in 2025 appears highly promising, offering opportunities for developers and investors to continue growing and innovating in response to the ever-evolving market dynamics.

Merujuk pada prospek usaha tersebut, Perseroan melanjutkan strategi pertumbuhan sebagai berikut:

1. Fokus pada diversifikasi geografis untuk mengembangkan projek-proyek di seluruh Indonesia. Saat ini, projek-proyek Perseroan tersebut di 34 (tiga puluh empat) kota di seluruh Indonesia;  
2. Mengunakan bisnis model kerja sama operasi yang efektif untuk mengembangkan proyek-proyek tersebut dengan memanfaatkan brand "CIPUTRA";  
3. Berkonsentrasi pada Produk perumahan dengan target pasar utama segmen menengah atas dan segmen di atasnya dan pengguna akhir (end user) sebagai pendorong utama;  
4. Menciptakan Produk-produk inovatif untuk memenuhi permintaanasar;  
5. Dalam rangka memperoleh manfaat dari kelanjutan diberlakukanya insentif PPN DTP, Perseroan akan kembali menetapkan strategi percepatan konstruksi untuk mencatkan pasokan (supply) Produk yang memenuhi kriteria;  
6. Mempertahankan jumlah kecukupan lahan (land bank) yang tersebut optimal untuk menjaga keberlanjutan Perseroan. Untuk itu, Perseroan makukan replenishing (menggantikan kembali jumlah lahan yang dikembangkan) di projek-proyek existing di samping mencari lokasibaru yang strategis dengan makukan ekspansi ke kota-kotaistarui Indonesia melalui skema kerjasama operasi;  
7. Menambah porsi pendapatan berulang (recurring income) sekalisus mencakkan sinergi dengan berfokus pada pengembangan Produk speerti mal, rumah sakit, dan perkantoran di projek-proyek existing; dan  
8. Melakukan pengelolaan modal (rasio utang bersih terhadap ekuitas) secara prudent (prudent capital management) dengan mengoptimalkan struktur utang melalui profil jatuh tempo pinjaman (debt maturity) yang seimbang dan sumber pendanaan yang beragam termasuk memastikan kecukupan likuiditas dan cadangan tunai.

# Aspek Pemasaran

# Strategi Pemasaran

Perseroan secara konsisten seksukan analisis terhadap minat dan selera pasar untuk mengeluarkan strategi terbaik dalam meluncurkan (launching) dan memasarkan Produkproduknya. Saat ini, Perseroan berfokus pada pemanfaatan tekologi digital (digital marketing initiative) dalam menjalankan strategi pemasaran,seperti pemanfaatan media online,media sosial,Google Ads,WA/SMS blasts, virtual tour, dan Youtube, di camping masih seksukan pemasaran secara offline melalui pameran, pembukaan show unit maupun spot kecil di mal atau pusat keramaian. Perseroan secara persusif juga seksukan strategi pendekatan dengan memberikan diskon dan bonus.

Referring to this business outlook, the Company continues to implement the following growth strategies:

1. Focusing on geographic diversification to develop projects across Indonesia. Currently, the Company's projects are spread across 34 (thirty-four) cities throughout the country;  
2. Utilizing an effective joint operation business model to develop new projects by leveraging the "CIPUTRA" brand;  
3. Concentrating on residential products targeting primarily the upper-middle and higher market segments, with end users as the main drivers;  
4. Creating innovative products to meet market demand;  
5. In order to benefit from the continued implementation of the VAT Incentives (PPN DTP), the Company will reapply a strategy of accelerating construction to increase the supply of qualifying products;  
6. Maintaining an optimal and healthy land bank to ensure the Company's sustainability. To achieve this, the Company replenishes land used in existing projects while also seeking new strategic locations through expansion into major cities across Indonesia using joint operation business scheme;  
7. Increasing the proportion of recurring income while enhancing synergy by focusing on the development of products such as malls, hospitals, and office buildings within existing projects; and  
8. Practicing prudent capital management by optimizing the debt structure through a balanced debt maturity profile and diversified funding sources, including ensuring sufficient liquidity and cash reserves.

# Marketing Aspects

# Marketing Strategy

The Company consistently conducts market interest and preference analysis to formulate the best strategies for launching and marketing its products. Currently, the Company is focusing on leveraging digital technology (digital marketing initiative) in its marketing strategy, such as the use of online media, social media, Google Ads, WA/SMS blasts, virtual tours, and YouTube, while still conducting offline marketing through exhibitions, show unit openings, and small booths in malls or other public areas. The Company also adopts a persuasive approach by offering discounts and bonuses.

# Prinsip Governansi Korporat Corporate Governance Principles

Sebagai perusahaan yang bergerak di sektor properti,;penerapan prinsip governansi korporat menjadi fondasi utama dalam mendukung operasional yangprofessional dan berintegritas. Perseroan Berkomitmen untuk menjalankan kegiatan usaha seksui dengan pedoman PUGKI 2021, yang mencakup 4 (empat) pilar utama: perilaku beretika, akuntabilitas, transparansi, dan keberlanjutan. Prinsip-prinsip ini menjadi pedoman dalam memastikan bahwa setiap keputusan bisnis mencerminkan tanggung jawab terhadap pemangku kepentingan, lingkungan, dan masyarakat luas.

As a company operating in the property sector, the implementation of corporate governance principles serves as a fundamental foundation in supporting professional and integrity-driven operations. # Kebijakan Governansi Korporat

# Corporate Governance Policies

Kebijakan governansi korporat menjadi landasan utama dalam memastikan pengelolaan bisnis berjalan secara transparan, bertanggung jawab, dan berorientasi pada keberlanjutan. Perseroan menetapkan standar operasional yang mencunjung integritas, etika, dan kepadahan hukum gunaMMCneneimbangkan pencapaian tujuan bisnis dengan tanggung jawab terhadap pemangku kepentingan,erta mendukung pertumbuhan jangka panjang yang sehata. Kebijakan tersebut meliputi:

1. Anggaran Dasar Perseroan;  
2. Peraturan Perseroan;  
3. Pedoman Kerja (Piagam/Charter);

- Pedoman Kerja Dewan Komisaris;  
- Pedoman Kerja Direksi;  
- Pedoman Kerja Komite Audit;  
- Pedoman Kerja Audit Internal;

4. Kode Etik Perseroan;

5. Whistleblowing System; sera  
6. Tata Nilai dan Budaya Perusahaan.

Perseroan menerapkan prinsip "apply or explain", dimana setiap pedoman diusahakan diterapkan secara konsisten. Jika ada yangbelum terlaksana, Perseroan akan memberikan penjelasan secara transparan.

The corporate governance policy serves as a fundamental foundation to ensure that business management is conducted in a transparent, responsible, and sustainability-oriented manner. The Company establishes operational standards that uphold integrity, ethics, and legal compliance to balance the achievement of business objectives with responsibility to stakeholders, as well as support healthy long-term growth. The policy includes:

1. The Company's Articles of Association;  
2. The Company's Regulation;  
3. Work Guidelines/Charters;

The Board of Commissioners Charter;  
The Board of Directors Charter;  
Audit Committee Charter;  
Internal Audit Charter;

4. The Company's Code of Conduct;

5. Whistleblowing System; and  
6. Company Values and Culture.

The Company applies the "apply or explain" principle, in which each guideline is attempted to be applied consistently. If there is a matter that has not been implemented, the Company will provide a transparent explanation.

# Struktur Governansi Korporat

# Corporate Governance Structures

Struktur governansi korporat Perseroan dirancang untuk memastikan pengelolaan yang efektif dan transparan melalui 3 (tiga) organ utama, yaitu organ kepemilikan, organ pengawasan, dan organ pengelolaan. Organ kepemilikan, yang diwakili oleh Rapat Umum Pemegang Saham (RUPS), berfungsi sebagai forum tertinggi bagi para pemegang saham untuk mengambil keputusan strategis. Dalam RUPS, pemegang saham memiliki hak untuk menyetujui kebijakan penting, termasuk penggangkatan dan pemberhentian anggota Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi,ILA, evaluasi atas kinerja Perseroan secara keseluruhan.

Organ pengawasan, yang diemban oleh Dewan Komisaris, bertugas mengawasi kinerja Direksi dan memberikan nasihat guna memastikan kegiatan operasional berjalan seksuai dengan visi, misi, dan peraturan yang berlaku. Sementara itu, Organ pengelolaan, yang dijalankan oleh Direksi, bertanggung jawab atas operasional perusahaan sehari-hari, termasuk merumuskan dan menciplementasikan strategi bisnis yang telah disetujui.

The Company's corporate governance structure is designed to ensure effective and transparent management through 3 (three) main organs: the ownership organ, the supervisory organ, and the management organ. The ownership organ, represented by the General Meeting of Shareholders (GMS), serves as the highest forum for shareholders to make strategic decisions. At the GMS, shareholders have the right to approve key policies, including the appointment and dismissal of members of the Board of Commissioners and the Board of Directors, as well as the overall evaluation of the Company's performance.

The supervisory organ, which is carried out by the Board of Commissioners, is responsible for overseeing the performance of the Board of Directors and providing advice to ensure that operations are conducted in accordance with the Company's vision, mission, and applicable regulations. Meanwhile, the management organ, represented by the Board of Directors, is responsible for the Company's day-to-day operations,

Dengan sinergi antara ketiga organ ini, Perseroan mampu menjaga keseimbangan antara kelentingan pemilik modal, pelaksana operasional, dan pengawas independen untuk mewujudkan tujuan bisnis yang berkelanjutan.

including formulating and implementing the approved business strategies. Through the synergy of these three organs, the Company can maintain a balance between the interests of capital owners, operational management, and independent oversight to achieve sustainable business objectives.

2. Peraturan OJK No. 32/POJK.04/2014 tanggal 8 Desember 2014 tentative Rencana dan Penyelenggaraan Rapat Umum Pemegang Saham Perseroan Terbuka sebagaihana tetlah diubah dengan Peraturan OJK No. 10/POJK.04/2017 tanggal 14 Maret 2017;服务于

Pada tahun 2024, Perseroan说我elenggaraman RUPS sesuai dengan POJK No. 15/POJK.04/2020tentang Rencana dan Penyelenggaraan Rapat Umum Pemegang Saham Perusahaan Terbukaanya POJK No. 16/POJK.04/2020tentang Pelaksanaan Rapat Umum Pemegang Saham Perusahaan Terbuka Secara Elektronik. Dalam pelaksanaannya, Perseroan说我yediakan infrastruktur yang dapat diakses oleh seluruh pemegang saham, baik institusi maupun individu, domestik maupun asing. Informasi terkait RUPS, mulai dari pemanggilan tingga risalah rapat, dapat diakses melalui situs resmi Perseroan di https://ciputradevelopment.com/id/hubungan-investor/pengungkapan/, sebagai pentuk transparansi dan kemadahan bagi para pemegang saham.

The GMS is the highest forum within the Company's corporate governance structure and plays a crucial role in strategic decision-making. The GMS serves as a platform for Shareholders to express their views and grant approval on key agendas, including the Company's performance, profit utilization, and the appointment of management members.

The GMS is divided into 2 (two) types: the Annual GMS and the Extraordinary GMS. The Annual GMS must be held at least once a year, no later than 6 (six) months after the financial year ends, while the Extraordinary GMS can be held at any time if necessary to discuss important matters other than those on the agenda of the Annual GMS.

# Legal Basis

The Company's GMS implementation refers to:

1. Law No. 40 of 2007 on Limited Liability Company;  
2. OJK Regulation No. 32/POJK.04/2014 dated December 8, 2014, on Plan and Implementation of General Meeting of Shareholders of Public Companies as amended by OJK Regulation No. 10/POJK.04/2017 dated March 14, 2017; and  
3. The Company's Articles of Association.

In 2024, the Company held the GMS in accordance with OJK Regulation No. 15/POJK.04/2020 on the Planning and Implementation of the General Meeting of Shareholders of Public Companies and OJK Regulation No. 16/POJK.04/2020 on the Electronic Implementation of the General Meeting of Shareholders of Public Companies. In its implementation, the Company provided infrastructure accessible to all shareholders, both institutional and individual, domestic and foreign. Information related to the GMS, from invitations to meeting minutes, can be accessed via the Company's official website at https://ciputradevelopment.com/id/hubungan-investor/pengungkapan/, as a form of transparency and convenience for all shareholders.

Rapat tersebut dihadiri oleh 5 (lima) anggota Dewan Komisaris dan 10 (sepuluh) anggota Direksi, baik secara fisik ataupun melalui konferensi video (virtual). # Tata cara pembayaran dividend tunai:

1. Pemberitahuan ini merupakan pemberitahuan resmi dari Perseroan dan Perseroan tidak mengeluarkan surat pemberitahuan secara khusus kepada para pemegang saham.  
2. Dividen tunai akan diberikan kepada para pemegang saham Perseroan yang namanya tercatak dalam Daftar Pemegang Saham (DPS) Perseroan untuk pemegang rekening efek pada PT Kustodian Sentral Efek Indonesia (KSEI) pada tanggal (recording date) 1 Juli 2024.  
3. Bagi pemegang saham yang sahamnya berada dalam penitipan kolektif KSEI, dividen tunai akan disampaikan melalui KSEI kepada perusahaan efek dan/atau bank kustodian dimana pemegang saham membruka rekeningnya. Pemegang saham Perseroan dapat memperoleh konfirmasi pembayaran dividen melalui perusahaan efek dan/atau bank kustodian dimana pemegang saham Perseroan membruka rekening efek. Bukti pemetongan pajak penghasilan (PPh) dividen dapat diambil di perusahaan efek atas bank kustodian dimana pemegang saham membruka rekening efeknya.  
4. Bagi pemegang saham warkat, Perseroan akan melaksananakan pembayaran dividemelalui pemindahbukuan ke rekening bank yang telah disampaikan pemegang saham kepada Perseroan secara tertulis di atas materai Rp10.000,- (sepuluh ribu Rupiah), dilampirkan fotokopi Kartu Tanda Penduduk seksuaiNama danAlamat yang tercatat dalam DPS Perseroan, dan disampaikan keAlamat Biro Administrrasi Efek (BAE) Perseroan, sebagai berikut:

# Procedures for cash dividend payment:

1. This notification is an official notification from the Company and the Company does not issue a notification letter specifically to shareholders.  
2. The cash dividend will be given to shareholders whose names are recorded in the Company's Register of Shareholders (DPS) or securities account holders in the collective custody of PT Kustodian Sentral Efek Indonesia (KSEI) at the close of stock trading on the recording date of July 1, 2024.  
3. For shareholders whose shares are placed in KSEI's collective custody, cash dividends will be delivered through KSEI to securities companies and/or custodian banks, where shareholders open their accounts. The Company's shareholders can obtain confirmation of dividend payment through securities companies and/or custodian banks, where the Company's shareholders open their securities accounts. Proof of income tax (PPh) deduction for dividends can be obtained at securities companies or custodian banks where the shareholders open their securities accounts.  
4. For script shareholders, the Company will make dividend payments through transmission to a bank account that has been submitted by the shareholders to the Company in writing on a stamp duty of Rp10,000 (ten thousand Rupiah), attached with a photocopy of Identity Card according to the name and address recorded in the Company's DPS, and submitted to the address of the Company's Securities Administration Bureau (BAE), as follows:

Based on applicable tax laws and regulations, cash dividends will be exempt from taxable objects if received by shareholders who are domestic corporate taxpayers (WP Badan DN) and the Company does not withhold income tax on cash dividends paid to the said WP Badan DN. Cash dividends received by domestic individual taxpayer shareholders (WPOP DN) will be exempted from tax objects as long as the dividends are invested in territory of the Republic of Indonesia. For WPOP DN who does not meet the investment requirements as stated above, the dividends received by the person concerned will be subject to Income Tax in accordance with the provisions of applicable laws and regulations, and the Income Tax must be paid by the relevant WPOP DN according to the provisions of Government Regulation No. 9 of 2021 on Tax Treatment to Support Ease of Doing Business.

# Dewan Komisaris

# Board of Commissioners

Dewan Komisaris memorandum organ penting dalam struktur governansi korporat yang bertugas mengawasi jalanya pengelolaan Perseroan oleh Direksi dan memberikan nasihat strategis kepada Direksi. Keberadaan Dewan Komisaris menjadi jaminan Bahwa kebujakan dan keputusan strategis Perseroan dilaksanan secara hati-hati dan aktivasi dengan peraturan yang berlaku.

The Board of Commissioners is a key organ in the corporate governance structure, responsible for overseeing the management of the Company by the Board of Directors and providing strategic advice to the Board of Directors. The presence of the Board of Commissioners ensures that the Company's policies and strategic decisions are implemented prudently and in compliance with applicable regulations.

Dewan Komisaris juga bertanggung jawab menjadi vampaikan laporan telah pengawasan kepada pemegang saham. Secara hukum, seluruh anggota Dewan Komisaris memiliki kedudukan yang setara. Namun, Komisaris Utama berperan mencoordinasikan tugas-tugas Dewan Komisaris dan menjadi vampaikan pandangan mereka kepada Direksi seda pemegang saham.

# Dasar Hukum

Dalam menjalankan tugas dan tanggung jawabnya, Dewan Komisaris senantiasa mematuhi dan berpedoman pada peraturan perdang-undangan yang berlaku sebagaimana diuraikan berikut:

1. Undang-Undang Republik Indonesia No. 40 Tahun 2007tentang Perseroan Terbatas;  
2. Peraturan OJK No. 33/POJK.04/2014 tentative Direksi dan Dewan Komisaris Emiten ataup Perusahaan Publik;  
3. Pedoman Umum Govnansi Korporat Indonesia 2021 dari Komite Nasional Kebijakan Govnansi; serta  
4. Pedoman Kerja Dewan Komisaris.

# Pedoman Kerja

Pedoman Kerja Dewan Komisaris merupakan dokumen resmi yang memuat ketentuan menjadi tugas, tanggung jawab, serta peraturan yang harus dijalankan oleh Dewan Komisaris dalam melaksanakan fungsinya di lingkungan Perseroan. Pedoman tersebut"></pemegang saham dan diumumkan secara terbuka melalui situs web resmi Perseroan. Melalui implementasi pedoman ini, Perseroan Berkomitmen untuk mendukung pengawasan yang efektif demi mewujudkan governansi corporat yang baik dalam rangka pencapaian tujuan strategis, seesingga dapat mencapatkan daya saing dan mempertahankan posisi Unggul di tengah dinamika persaingan yang semakin kompetitif.

Pedoman Kerja Dewan Komisaris menjut:

1. Persyaratan Dewan Komisaris;  
2. Rangkap Jabatan Dewan Komisaris;  
3. Tugas, Wewenang, dan Tanggung Jawab Dewan Komisaris;  
4. Waktu Kerja Dewan Komisaris;  
5. Kebijakan Rapat Dewan Komisaris;  
6. Pelaporan dan Pertanggungjawaban Dewan Komisaris;erta  
7. Pengunduran Diri.

The Board of Commissioners is also responsible for submitting oversight reports to the shareholders. Legally, all members of the Board of Commissioners hold equal standing. However, the President Commissioner is tasked with coordinating the duties of the Board of Commissioners and conveying their views to the Board of Directors and shareholders.

# Legal Basis

In carrying out its duties and responsibilities, the Board of Commissioners consistently adheres to and is guided by the prevailing laws and regulations, as outlined below:

1. Law of the Republic of Indonesia No. 40 of 2007 on Limited Liability Companies;  
2. OJK Regulation No. 33/POJK.04/2014 on the Board of Directors and Board of Commissioners of Issuers or Public Companies;  
3. General Guidelines for Indonesian Corporate Governance 2021 from the National Committee for Governance Policy; and  
4. The Board of Commissioners Charter.

# Board Charter

The Board of Commissioners' Charter is an official document containing provisions regarding duties, responsibilities, and regulations that the Board of Commissioners must carry out in performing its functions within the Company. The guidelines have been prepared, approved by the shareholders, and made available openly through the Company's official website. Through the implementation of this charter, the Company is committed to supporting effective supervision to realize good corporate governance in order to achieve strategic goals, so as to increase competitiveness and maintain the excellent position amidst the increasingly competitive dynamics.

The Board Charter for the Board of Commissioners stipulates the following matters:

1. Requirements of the Board of Commissioners;  
2. Concurrent Positions of the Board of Commissioners;  
3. Duties, Authorities, and Responsibilities of the Board of Commissioners;  
4. Working Time of the Board of Commissioners;  
5. Policy of the Board of Commissioners Meeting;  
6. Reporting and Accountability of the Board of Commissioners; and  
7. Resignation.

Pedoman Kerja Dewan Komisaris tersedia di situs web resmi Perseroan setzen wujud transparansi dan informasi dati pemangkukeesentingan erkait peran dan tanggung jawab Direksi dalam mendukung governansi korporat.

# Tugas Dewan Komisaris

1. Setiap anggota Dewan Komisaris bertugas mengasidi dan mempertanggungjawabkan pengawasan atas kebikan pengurusan, jalanya pengurusan pada umumnya, baik mengenai Perseroan maupun kinerja Perseroan,erta pemberian nasihat kepada Direksi;  
2. Dewan Komisaris wajib menyelenggaramakan RUPS Tahunan dan RUPS lainnya jika dibutuhkan sesuai dengan kewenangannya sebagai diatur dalam peraturan perundang-undangan dan Anggaran Dasar;  
3. Anggota Dewan Komisaris wajib melaksanakanugas dan tanggung jawab dengan itikad baik, penuh tanggung jawab, dan kehati-hatian;  
4. Dalam rangka mendukung efektivitas pelaksanaan tugas dan tanggung jawabnya Dewan Komisaris wajib membentuk Komite Audit dan dapat membentuk komite lainnya; serta  
5. Dewan Komisaris wajib seksukan evaluasi terhadap kinerja komite yang membantu pelaksanaan tugas dan tanggung jawabnya setiap akhir tahun buku.

# Tanggung Jawab Dewan Komisaris

1. Setiap anggota Dewan Komisaris bertanggung jawab secara tanggung renteng atas kerugian Perseroan yang disebabkan oleh kesalahan atas kalalaian anggota Dewan Komisaris dalam menjalankan tugasnya;

The Board of Commissioners' Charter is available on the Company's official website as a form of transparency and information for stakeholders regarding the role and responsibilities of the Board of Directors in supporting corporate governance.

# The Board of Commissioners Duties

1. Each member of the Board of Commissioners is responsible for supervising and is accountable for the supervision of the management policies, the management functions in general, both regarding the Company and its business, and providing advice to the Board of Directors;  
2. The Board of Commissioners is required to hold the Annual GMS and other GMS if needed in accordance with its authority as stipulated in the laws and regulations, as well as the Articles of Association;  
3. Members of the Board of Commissioners must carry out their duties and responsibilities in good faith, full of responsibility, and with prudence;  
4. In order to support the effectiveness of the implementation of its duties and responsibilities, the Board of Commissioners is required to establish an Audit Committee and may establish other committees as well; and  
5. The Board of Commissioners is required to evaluate the performance of the board committees which assist its duties and responsibilities at the end of each financial year.

# The Board of Commissioners Authorities

1. The Board of Commissioners is authorized to temporarily dismiss members of the Board of Directors, providing the reasons for such dismissal;  
2. The Board of Commissioners may undertake management functions of the Company under certain circumstances for a specified period of time; and  
3. The authority referred to in point (2) is determined based on the Articles of Association or resolutions of the General Meeting of Shareholders.

# The Board of Commissioners Responsibilities

1. Each member of the Board of Commissioners is jointly responsible for the Company's losses caused by the errors or negligence of members of the Board of Commissioners in carrying out their duties;

2. Anggota Dewan Komisaris tidak dapat diminta bertanggung jawab atas kerugian Perseroan sebagai dimaksud pada ayat (1) apabila dapat membuktikan:

a. Kerugian thereby but bukan karena kesalahan ata kalalaiannya;  
b. Telah makukan pengawasan dengan itikad baik, penuh tanggung jawab, dan kehati-hatian untuk kelentingan dan sesuai dengan maksud dan tujuan Perseroan;  
c. Tidak mempunyai benturan kepentingan baik langsung maupun tidak langsung atas;tindakan pengawasan yang mengakibatkan kerugian;tering  
d. Telah mencambil tindakan untuk mencegah timbul atau berlanjutnya kerugian tersebut.

# Pengangkatan dan Pemberhentian

Pemilihan anggota Dewan Komisaris merupakan proses penting yang mencerminkan komitmen Perseroan terhadap governansi korporat. Pemilihan anggota Dewan Komisaris dilakukan melalui mekanisme yang transparan dengan persetujuan RUPS. Setelah disetuji, telah pemilihan ini dilaporkan kepada OJK sebagai pentuk kepadahan terhadap regulasi. Calon anggota Dewan Komisaris harus memenuhi kriteria yang ketat, termasuk memiliki integritas yang tinggi, pengalaman yang relevant, dan kemampuan untuk bekerja secara independen. Selain itu,mereka wajib memahami nilai-nilai Perseroan, etika kerja, Anggaran Dasar, dan peraturan yang berlaku untuk memastikan keselarasan dengan visi dan misi Perseroan.

Masa jabatan Dewan Komisaris dapat berakhir karena menjadi alasan,seperti mencapai usia pensiun, berakhirnya periode tugas,tidak lagi memenuhi persyaratan yang ditetapkan,meninggal dunia,atau keputusan RUPS.Jika seorang anggota Dewan Komisaris memutuskan untuk mengundurkan diri sebelum masa jabatanya berakhir,mereka diwajibkan mengajukan permohonan resmi kepada Perseroan.

Perseroan bertanggung jawab untuk menyelenggaramkan RUPS dalam waktu 90 (sembilan puluh) hari setelah menerima permohonan pengunduran diri. Selain itu, Perseroan wajib menginformasikan kepada publik dan melaporkan kepada OJK dalam waktu 2 (dua) hari kerja sejak menerima permohonan tersebut{serta mencampaikan telah keputusan RUPS.

2. Member of the Board of Commissioners cannot be held responsible for the loss of the Company as referred to in point (1) if they can prove:

a. The loss is not due to an errors or negligence;  
b. Has carried out supervision in good faith, full of responsibility, and prudence for the interests and in accordance with the purposes and objectives of the Company;  
c. Does not have a conflict of interest, either directly or indirectly, over management actions that result in losses; and  
d. Has taken action to prevent the occurrence or continuation of the loss.

# Appointment and Dismissal

The election of members of the Board of Commissioners is an important process that reflects the Company's commitment to corporate governance. The election of members of the Board of Commissioners is carried out through a transparent mechanism with the approval of GMS. Once approved, the results are reported to the Financial Services Authority (OJK) as part of regulatory compliance. Candidates for the Board of Commissioners must meet strict criteria, including high integrity, relevant experience, and the ability to work independently. In addition, they are required to understand the Company's values, work ethics, Articles of Association, and applicable regulations to ensure alignment with the Company's vision and mission.

The term of office for the Board of Commissioners may end for various reasons, such as reaching the retirement age, the expiration of their term, no longer meeting the required qualifications, passing away, or through a decision of the GMS. If a member of the Board of Commissioners decides to resign before the end of their term, they are required to submit an official resignation request to the Company.

The Company is responsible for convening a GMS within 90 (ninety) days after receiving the resignation request. Additionally, the Company must inform the public and report the resignation to the Financial Services Authority (OJK) within 2 (two) working days after receiving the request and submit the GMS decision thereafter.

# Komposisi dan Masa Jabatan

Dewan Komisaris terdiri dari 6 (enam) anggota yang memiliki peran strategis dalam pengawasan dan pemberian nasihat kepada Direksi. Struktur Dewan Komisaris mencakup 1 (satu) Komisaris Utama, 2 (dua) Komisaris, dan 3 (tiga) Komisaris Independen, yang keseluruhanya dipilih berdasarkan kompetensi dan integritas yang dimiliki. Masa jabatan setiap anggota Dewan Komisaris berakhir apabila yang bersangkutan mengajukan pengunduran diri secara resmi, tidak lagi memenuhi persyaratan seksuai dengan ketentuan yang berlaku, meninggal dunia, oleh diberhentikan melalui keputusan RUPS. # Komisaris Independen

Komisaris Independen merupakan bagian penting dari struktur Dewan Komisaris yang berperan menjaga objektivitas dan independensi dalam pengawasan Perseroan, serta memastikan keputusan strategis diambil secara transparan dan adil. Dengan tidak memiliki affiliasi dengan pemegang saham mayoritas atas Direksi, Komisaris Independen mendukung;penerapan governansi korporat serta melindungi kepentingan tersebut pemangku kepentingan.

# Dasar Hukum

Komisaris Independen memiliki dasar hukum yang diatur secara jelas untuk menjamin keberadaannya dalam struktur governansi korporat. Selain itu, peraturan OJK juga memberikan panduan khusus yang mewajibkan perusahaan publik memiliki Komisaris Independen seksagai bagian dari Dewan Komisaris, guna memastikan kepadauhan terhadap prinsip-prinsip governansi korporat. Komisaris Independen Perseroan telah mematuhi dan berpedoman kepada menjadi peraturan sebagai manana diuraikan berikut:

1. POJK No. 33/POJK.04/2014 /(teng) direksi dan Dewan Komisaris Emiten atau Perusahaan Publik;

# Independent Commissioner

Independent Commissioner is a vital part of the Board of Commissioners' structure, playing a key role in maintaining objectivity and independence in the supervision of the Company, as well as ensuring that strategic decisions are made in a transparent and fair manner. By not having any affiliation with the majority shareholders or the Board of Directors, the Independent Commissioner supports the implementation of corporate governance and safeguards the interests of all stakeholders.

# Legal Basis

The Independent Commissioner has a clear legal basis to ensure their existence within the corporate governance structure. Additionally, the OJK regulations provide specific guidelines that require publicly listed companies to have an Independent Commissioner as part of the Board of Commissioners, to ensure compliance with corporate governance principles. The Independent Commissioners of the Company have adhered to and followed several regulations as outlined below:

1. POJK No. 33/POJK.04/2014 on the Board of Directors and Board of Commissioners of Issuers or Public Companies;

2. PUGKI 2021 yang diterbitkan Komite Nasional Kebijakan Governansi (KNKG);{serta  
3. Pedoman Kerja Dewan Komisaris.

# Komposisi dan Masa Jabatan

Dalam struktur Dewan Komisaris, Komisaris Independen harus memenuhi percentase tertentu seksuai dengan ketentuan regulator,seperti minimal  $30\%$  (tiga puluh persen) dari jumlah anggota Dewan Komisaris. Pada tahun 2024, komposisi Komisaris Independen sudah seksuai dengan peraturan tersebut.

Komisaris Independen memiliki masa jabatan maksimal 2 (dua)periode berturut-turut.Jika ingin diangkat kembali untukperiode berikutnya,Komisaris Independen wajib mencayaratan tetap independen kepada RUPS.Namun, apabila Komisaris Independen juga menjabat sebagai anggota Komite Audit,masa jabatan di Komite Auditanya dapat diperpanjang untuk 1 (satu)periode tambahan.

# Pernyataan Independensi

Setiap Komisaris Independen telah menandatangani pernyataan independensi yang terus diperbarui secara Berkala, sesuai dengan POJK No. 33/POJK.04/2014 dan SEOJK No. 16/SEOJK.04/2021. Pernyataan Independen tersebut diuraikan sebagai berikut:

2. PUGKI 2021 issued by the National Committee on Governance Policy (KNKG); and  
3. The Board of Commissioners' Charter.

# Composition and Term of Office

In the structure of the Board of Commissioners, the Independent Commissioner must meet a certain percentage as required by the regulator, such as at least  $30\%$  (thirty percent) of the total members of the Board of Commissioners. In 2024, the composition of Independent Commissioners was in accordance with the regulation.

An Independent Commissioner has a maximum tenure of 2 (two) consecutive periods. If reappointed for the following period, the Independent Commissioner must declare their continued independence to the GMS. However, if the Independent Commissioner also serves as a member of the Audit Committee, their tenure on the Audit Committee can only be extended for 1 (one) additional period.

# Performance Assessment of Audit Committee

The Board of Commissioners is responsible for conducting periodic assessments of Audit Committee performance as part of efforts to ensure the effectiveness of supervisory function carried out by the Company. The Board of Commissioners uses the results of the Audit Committee's performance assessment to strengthen its functions, improve competence, and improve the committee's work processes. This assessment also serves as the basis for appreciation and input to ensure the strategic role and independence of Audit Committee in supporting accountable and sustainable corporate governance. # Board of Directors

Direksi merupakan organ pengelola Perseroan yang bertanggung jawab atas operasional harian dan keberlanjutan usaha jangka panjang. Dalam pelaksanaannya, Direksi wajib mematuhi Anggaran Dasar, peraturan OJK, peraturan bursa, seda ketentuan perundang-undangan yang berlaku. Direksi bekerja secara kolegial, dengan pembagian tugas dan tanggung jawab seksuai kompetensi masingmasing anggota. Dalam susunnya, Direktur Utama bertugas untuk mencoordinasikan seluruh anggota Direksiagarapat memastikan setiap keputusan dapat dipertanggungjawabkan bersama.

Dalam menjalankan tugas dan tanggung jawabnya, Direksi senantiasa mematuhi dan berpedoman pada peraturan perdang-undangan yang berlaku sebagaimana diuraikan berikut:

1. Undang-Undang Republik Indonesia No. 40 Tahun 2007tentang Perseroan Terbatas;  
2. Peraturan OJK No. 33/POJK.04/2014 tentative Direksi dan Dewan Komisaris Emiten pada Perusahaan Publik;  
3. PUGKI 2021 dari Komite Nasional Kebijakan Governansi; serta  
4. Pedoman Kerja Direksi.

Pedoman ini memastikan pengelolaan Perseroan dilakukan secara transparan, akuntabel, dan berintegritas.

The Board of Directors is the Company's management organ responsible for day-to-day operations and long-term business sustainability. In its implementation, the Board of Directors is required to comply with the Articles of Association, OJK regulations, stock exchange regulations, and applicable laws and regulations. The Board of Directors works collegially, with the division of duties and responsibilities according to the competence of each member. In its composition, the President Director is in charge of coordinating all members of the Board of Directors to ensure that they are collectively accountable for every decision made.

# Legal Basis

In carrying out its duties and responsibilities, the Board of Directors consistently complies with and adheres to the applicable laws and regulations as outlined below:

1. Law of the Republic of Indonesia No. 40 of 2007 on Limited Liability Companies;  
2. OJK Regulation No. 33/POJK.04/2014 on the Board of Directors and Board of Commissioners of Issuers or Public Companies;  
3. PUGKI 2021 from the National Committee for Governance Policy; and

# Board Charter

The Company has prepared the Board of Directors' Charter as the main reference for the Board of Directors in carrying out its duties and responsibilities professionally, in line with the Company's vision, mission, strategy, and applicable regulations. These guidelines ensure that the Company management is carried out transparently, accountableably, and with integrity.

Pedoman Kerja Direksi tersebut hal-al berikut:

1. Persyaratan Direksi;  
2. Rangkap Jabatan Direksi;  
3. Tugas, Wewenang, dan Tanggung Jawab Direksi;  
4. Waktu Kerja Direksi;  
5. Kebijakan Rapat Direksi;  
6. Pelaporan dan Pertanggungjawaban Direksi; seda  
7. Pengunduran Diri dan Pemberhentian Sementara.

Pedoman Kerja Direksi tersedia di situs web resmi Perseroan besteht wujud transparansi dan informasi dati pemangku kepentingan erkait peran dan tanggung jawab Direksi dalam mendukung governansi korporat.

# Tugas Direksi

1. Direksi bertugas menjalankan dan bertanggung jawab atas pengurusan Perseroan untuk kepentingan Perseroan sesuai dengan maksud dan tujuan Perseroan yang ditetapkan dalam Anggaran Dasar;  
2. Dalam menjalankan tugas dan tanggung jawab atas pengurusan sebagaimana dimaksud pada ayat (1), Direksi wajib说我elenggaraman RUPS Tahunan dan RUPS lainnya sebagaimana diatur dalam peraturan perundang-undangan dan Anggaran Dasar;  
3. Setiap anggota Direksi wajib melaksanakan tugas dan tanggung jawab sebagai imana dimaksud pada ayat (1) dengan itikad baik, penuh tanggung jawab, dan kehati-hatian;  
4. Dalam rangka mendukung efektivitas pelaksanaan tugas dan tanggung jawab sebagaimana dimaksud pada ayat (1) Direksi dapat membrentuk komite; seda  
5. Dalam hal dibentuknya komite seksbagaimana dimaksud pada ayat (4), Direksi wajib melakukan evaluasi terhadap kinerja komite setiap akhir tahun buku.

# Wewenang Direksi

1. Direksi berwenang menjalankan pengurban sebagaimana dimaksud di atas, seksuai dengan kebjikan yang dipandang tepat serta maksud dan tujuan yang ditetapkan dalam Anggaran Dasar;  
2. Direksi berwenang mewakili Perseroan di dalam dan di luar pengadilan;  
3. Anggota Direksi tidak berwenang mewakili Perseroan apabila:

a. Terdapat perkara di pengadilan antara Perseroan dengan anggota Direksi yang bersangkutan;tering

The Board of Directors' Charter is available on the Company's official website as a form of transparency and information for stakeholders regarding the role and responsibilities of the Board of Directors in supporting corporate governance.

# The Board of Directors Duties

1. The Board of Directors is in charge of carrying out and being responsible for managing the Company for the Company interest in accordance with the purposes and objectives of the Company as stipulated in the Articles of Association;  
2. In carrying out its duties and responsibilities for the administration as referred to in point (1), the Board of Directors shall hold the Annual GMS and other GMS as regulated in laws and regulations, and Articles of Association;  
3. Each member of the Board of Directors shall perform his/her duties and responsibilities as referred to in point (1) in good faith, full of responsibility, and prudence;  
4. In order to support the effectiveness of the implementation of duties and responsibilities as referred to in point (1) the Board of Directors may establish a committee; and  
5. In terms of committee establishment as referred to in point (4), the Board of Directors shall evaluate the performance of the committee at the end of each financial year.

# The Board of Directors Authorities

1. The Board of Directors is authorized to carry out the management function as referred to above, in accordance with the applicable policies, the purposes and objectives as stipulated in the Articles of Association;  
2. The Board of Directors is authorized to represent the Company in and out of court;  
3. The members of the Board of Directors are not authorized to represent the Company if:

a. There is a court case between the Company and the involved member of the Board of Directors; and

b. Anggota Direksi bersangkutan mempunyai kepada orang yang berbenturan dengan kepada orang Perseroan.

4. Apabila terdapat keadaan seksagaimana dimaksud pada ayat (3), yang berhak mewakili Perseroan adalah:

a. Anggota Direksi lainnya yang tidak mempunyai benturan kepentingan dengan Perseroan;  
b. Dewan Komisaris apabila Seluruh anggota Direksi mempunyai benturan kepentingan dengan Perseroan; atau  
c. Pihak lain yang ditunjuk oleh RUPS apabila seluruh anggota Direksi untuk Dewan Komisaris mempunyai benturan kepada dengan Perseroan.

# Tanggung Jawab Direksi

2. Anggota Direksi tidak dapat diminta bertanggung jawab atas kerugian Perseroan sebagai dimaksud pada ayat (1) apabila dapat membuktikan:

a. Kerugian thereby bukan karena kesalahan ata kalalaiannya;  
b. Telah makukan pengurusan dengan itikad baik, penuh tanggung jawab, dan kehati-hatian untuk kepentingan dan sesuai dengan maksud dan tujuan Perseroan;

# The Board of Directors Responsibilities

1. Each member of the Board of Directors shall be jointly liable for any Company loss caused by any errors or negligence of the members of the Board of Directors in performing their duties; and  
2. Members of the Board of Directors cannot be held liable for losses incurred by the Company as referred to in point (1) if they can prove that:

a. The loss was not due to an error or negligence;  
b. They managed the Company in good faith, with full responsibility and prudence, in the interest of and in accordance with the purposes and objectives of the Company;  
c. They had no conflict of interest, whether directly or indirectly, in the management actions that resulted in the loss; and  
d. They took appropriate actions to prevent the occurrence or continuation of such loss.

# Pengangkatan dan Pemberhentian

Proses pemberhentian dan pengangkatan Direksi diatur melalui mekanisme yang melibatkan Dewan Komisaris sebagai organ yang menjalankan fungsi nominasi. Dewan Komisaris memiliki tugas untuk menentukan kandidat Direksi dengan mempertimbangkan berbagai sumber, termasuk di antaranya calon-calon yang berasal dari dalam Dewan Komisaris sendiri, manajemen Perseroan, pemegang saham mayoritas, atau sumber independen. Pemilihan kandidat ini dilakukan dengan menilai pengetahuan, kemampuan, dan keahlian yang relevanta memperhatikan aspek keberagaman dalam susunan Direksi. Kandidat yang telah terpilih kemudian diajukan untuk mendapatkan persetujuan di RUPS.

Setelah ditetapkan melalui RUPS, Direksi yang menjadi dapat mengundurkan diri dari posisinya sebelum masa jabatan berakhir, dengan menjukan permohonan pengunduran diri. Selain itu, pemberhentian Direksi juga dapat terjadi akibat keputusan RUPS kepada kondisi lainseperti mencgal dunia. Dalam hal pengunduran diri, Perseroan diwajibkan menyelenggarakan RUPS paling lambat 90 (sebilan puluh) hari setelah permohonan pengunduran diri diterima.

Sebagai bagian dari transparansi dan kepadahan terhadap regulasi, Perseroan wajib menjadi angan informasi tersebut pengunduran diri Direksi kepada publik dan OJK. Informasi ini harus disampaikan selambat-lambatnya 2 (dua) hari kerja setelah permohonan pengunduran diri diterima. Selain itu, telah dari penyelenggaraan RUPS tersebut pengunduran diri Direksi juga wajib diinformasikan dalam jangka waktu yang sama. Langkah ini bertujuan untuk menjaga kepercayaan pemangku kepada orang daru pengunduran diri direkter.

# Appointment and Dismissal

The process of appointment and dismissal of the Board of Directors is regulated through a mechanism that involves the Board of Commissioners in its role as the nominating body. The Board of Commissioners is responsible for identifying candidates for the Board of Directors by considering various sources, including candidates from within the Board of Commissioners itself, the Company's management, the majority shareholders, or independent sources. The selection of candidates is carried out by assessing their knowledge, capabilities, and relevant expertise, while also considering diversity in the composition of the Board of Directors. Selected candidates are then proposed for approval at the GMS.

Once appointed through the GMS, the Board of Directors may resign from their position before the end of their term by submitting a formal resignation letter. Additionally, dismissal of the Board of Directors may occur through a GMS resolution or due to other circumstances, such as death. In the event of a resignation, the Company is required to hold a GMS no later than 90 (ninety) days after the resignation request is received.

As part of transparency and regulatory compliance, the Company is required to disclose information regarding the resignation of the Board of Director to the public and the Financial Services Authority (OJK). This information must be submitted no later than 2 (two) working days after the resignation request is received. In addition, the results of the GMS related to the resignation must also be disclosed within the same timeframe. This step is intended to maintain stakeholders' trust in the Company's corporate governance.

# Pelaksanaan Tugas Direksi

Direksi sebagai organ yang bertanggung jawab PENH terhadap pengelolaan Perseroan memiliki tugas yang telah ditetapkan sesuai dengan peraturan perundang-undangan. Selama tahun buku 2024, Direksi melaksanan tugasnya dengan rincian sebagai berikut:

1. Menyusun dan melaksanakan kebijakan strategis Perseroan dengan tujuan untuk mencapai visi dan misi yang telah ditetapkan, seda memastikan pencapaian tujuan jangka panjang Perseroan;  
2. Mengelola operasional Perseroan secara efisien dan efektif, dengan fokus pada optimalisi sumber daya, peningkatan produktivitas, dan keberlanjutan usaha guna mendukung pertumbuhan perusahaan yang stabil;  
3. Menyelenggarakan RUPS Tahunan seksuai dengan ketentuan yang tercantum dalam peraturan perundang-undangan dan Anggaran Dasar; tersebut  
4. Menyusun anggaran tahunan dengan perencanaan yang matang dan mengelola keuangan Perseroan secara bijaksana seda bertanggung jawab, untuk memastikan kesehatan financial Perseroan dan pencapaian sasaran bisnis yang telah ditapkan.

# Performance Assessment of Committees Under the Board of Directors

Until the end of 2024, the Company had not established any committees under the Board of Directors to support the execution of its duties and responsibilities. # Implementation of the Board of Directors' Duties

The Board of Directors, as the Company's organ with full responsibility for the Company's management, carries out duties as stipulated by applicable laws and regulations. The following are the specifics of how the Board of Directors carried out its duties during the 2024 financial year:

1. Formulating and implementing the Company's strategic policies with the aim of achieving the established vision and mission, as well as ensuring the achievement of the Company's long-term goals;  
2. Managing the Company's operations efficiently and effectively, focusing on optimizing resources, increasing productivity, and ensuring business sustainability to support stable company growth;  
3. Holding the Annual GMS in accordance with the provisions stated in the laws and the Articles of Association; and  
4. Preparing the annual budget with careful planning and managing the Company's finances wisely and responsibly, to ensure the Company's financial health and the achievement of the established business targets.

# Penilaian Kinerja Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi Performance Assessment of the Board of Commissioners and Board of Directors

Penilaian kinerja:tahunan Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi dilakukan untuk menjalil efektivitas pelaksanaan tugas dan tanggung jawab. Proses ini dilaksanan secara terbuka dan akuntabel, dimana seluruh informasi relevant harus diungkapkan secara transparan,seperti kriteria,proses, dan hasil penilaian. Penilaian ini dilakukan dengan mencungenakan metode self-assessment,peer assessment, serta penilaian oleh pihak ketiga yang dilakukan Direktur Utama dan Dewan Komisaris.Hasil penilaian digunakan untuk menuyusun rencana pengembangan,meningkatkan kompetensi, dan memperbaiki area yang memerlukan perhatian lebih,kehingga Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi dapat menjalankan perannya secara optimal dan mendukung pertumbuhan dan keberlanjutan Perseroan.

# Prosedur Pelaksanaan Penilaian Kinerja

Prosedur penilaian kinerja Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi dilaksanan secara internal melalui mekanisme RUPS yang melibatkan pemegang saham. Dewan Komisaris bertanggung jawab untuk menilai kinerja Direktur Utama seda anggota Direksi lainnya, dengan terlebih dahulu menetapkan kriteria penilaian yang jelas dan komunikatif kepada Direktur Utama. Kriteria tersebut dirancang untuk mendorong pencapaian tujuan Perseroan yang selaras dengan visi dan misi Perseroan, seda menciptakan nilai berkelanjutan.

Proses penilaian kinerja dimulai dengan evaluasi terhadap kompetensi dan keahlian Direktur Utama, yangunjati dasar dalam mereka pencapaian kinerja. Selain itu, penilaian juga mencakup kinerja komite-komite yang berada di bawah Dewan Komisaris, seda penilaian mandiri dan evaluasi dari rekan-rekan kerja terkait pelaksanaan tugas dan tanggung jawab Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi. Setelah seluruh telah penilaian terkumpul, Dewan Komisaris akan melakukan pertimbangan menyeluruh untuk menghasilkan keputusan final yang mendukung perbaikan kinerja dan pengembangan berkelanjutan Perseroan.

# Kriteria Penilaian

Dewan Komisaris menetapkan kriteria penilaian kinerja\
bagi Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi secara cermat,\
sesuai dengan tanggung jawab dan strategi Perseroan,

The annual performance assessment of the Board of Commissioners and Board of Directors is conducted to assess the effectiveness of duties and responsibilities implementation. This process is carried out openly and accountably, in which all relevant information must be disclosed transparently, such as criteria, processes, and assessment results. This assessment is carried out by using various methods such as self-assessment, peer assessment, and third-party assessment conducted by President Director and the Board of Commissioners. The assessment results are used to prepare development plans, improve competencies, and improve areas that require more attention, so that the Board of Commissioners and Board of Directors can carry out their roles optimally and support the growth and sustainability of the Company.

# Procedure for Performance Assessment

The performance assessment procedure for the Board of Commissioners and the Board of Directors is carried out internally through the mechanism of the GMS, which involves the shareholders. The Board of Commissioners is responsible for evaluating the performance of the President Director and other members of the Board of Directors, by first establishing clear and communicative evaluation criteria for the President Director. These criteria are designed to encourage the achievement of the Company's goals, aligned with the vision and mission of the Company, as well as to create sustainable value.

The performance assessment process begins with an assessment of the President Director's competencies and expertise, which forms the basis for assessing performance achievements. Additionally, the assessment includes the performance of the committees under the Board of Commissioners, as well as self-assessments and evaluations from colleagues regarding the execution of the tasks and responsibilities of the Board of Commissioners and the Board of Directors. Once all evaluation results have been gathered, the Board of Commissioners will conduct a comprehensive review to make a final decision that supports performance improvement and the sustainable development of the Company.

# Assessment Criteria

The Board of Commissioners determines carefully the performance assessment criteria for the Board of Commissioners and Board of Directors, in accordance with

guna memastikan evaluasi yang transparan, objektif, dan mendukung pencapaian tujuan Perseroan. Kriteria penilaian kinerja Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi telah disetujui oleh Dewan Komisaris, yang juga memastikan evaluasi anggota Direksi oleh Direktur Utama dilakukan secara objektif dan sesuai kriteria.

Kriteria penilaian kinerja untok Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi Perseroan terdiri dari hal-hal sebagai berikut:

1. Evaluasi pribadi;  
2. Evaluasi kompetensi;  
3. Kinerja komite-komite Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi,enta rekomendasi perbaikan yang diperlukan (bila ada);  
4. Efektivitas pelaksanaan tanggung jawab dan proses kerja Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi;  
5. Efektivitas rapat Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi; dan  
6. Evaluasi diri dan rekanunjawat.

the Company's responsibilities and strategies, to ensure that the evaluation is transparent, objective, and supports the achievement of the Company's objectives. The performance assessment criteria for the Board of Commissioners and Board of Directors have been approved by the Board of Commissioners, which also ensures that the evaluation of members of the Board of Directors by the President Director is carried out objectively and according to the criteria.

The performance assessment criteria for the Board of Commissioners and the Board of Directors of the Company include the following aspects:

1. Personal evaluation;  
2. Competency evaluation;  
3. The performance of the committees of the Board of Commissioners and the Board of Directors, as well as recommendations for necessary improvements (if any);  
4. Effectiveness of the implementation of the responsibilities and work processes of the Board of Commissioners and Directors;  
5. Effectiveness of Board of Commissioners and Board of Directors meetings; and  
6. Self and peer evaluation.

# Fungsi Nominasi dan Remunerasi

# Nomination and Remuneration Function

Sampai dengan tahun 2024, Perseroanbelum membrantuk Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi karena fungsi danugas terkait nominasi dan remunerasi sebagai dijalankan secara efektif oleh Dewan Komisaris. Hal ini sesuai dengan POJK No.34/POJK.4/2014tentang Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi Emiten Perusahaan Publik yang mengizinkan Dewan Komisaris untuk melaksananakan tugas tersebut secara langsung, terutama pada Perseroan dengan skala dan kompleksitas yang makeshift memungkankan pengawasan dilakukan tanpa membrantuk komite khusus.

Tugas dan tanggung jawab yang dilakukan Dewan Komisaris perihal fungsi nominasi dan remunerasi, yaitu:

1. Menyusun kriteria dan prosedur penyeleksian nominasi;  
2. Menyeleksi calon anggota Direksi dan Dewan Komisaris;  
3. Menentukan remunerasi untuk anggota Direksi dan Dewan Komisaris;{serta  
4. Menentukan dan melaksanakan pengawasan atas kebjikan nominasi dan remunerasi bagi Direksi dan Dewan Komisaris.

Until 2024, the Company has not established a Nomination and Remuneration Committee, as the functions and tasks related to nominations and remuneration are still effectively carried out by the Board of Commissioners. This is in accordance with POJK No. 34/POJK.4/2014 on Nomination and Remuneration Committee of Issuers of Public Companies which allows the Board of Commissioners to carry out these duties directly, particularly in Companies with a scale and complexity that still allows supervision to be carried out without establishing a specific committee.

The Board of Commissioners' duties and responsibilities regarding the nomination and remuneration function are:

1. To develop criteria and procedures for selecting nominees;  
2. To select candidates for the Board of Directors and Board of Commissioners;  
3. To determine the remuneration for members of the Board of Directors and Board of Commissioners; and  
4. Determining and supervising the nomination and remuneration policies for the Board of Directors and Board of Commissioners.

mayoritas. Kriteria yang ditentukan harus mencakup pengetahunan, kemampuan,erta keahlian yang sesuai dengan peran, dan juga memperhatikan keberagaman dari para anggota.

# Remuneration Procedures for the Board of Directors and Board of Commissioners

The Board of Commissioners is responsible for formulating the structure, policies, and amount of remuneration for both the Board of Directors and the Board of Commissioners. This formulation is carried out by taking into account corporate governance principles and aligning with the responsibilities and contributions of each party to the Company.

The proposed remuneration amount, as determined by the Board of Commissioners, is then submitted for approval at the Annual GMS. At the Annual GMS held on June 19, 2024, the shareholders approved a  $4\%$  (four percent) increase in salaries and allowances for the Board of Commissioners. This increase was determined based on performance evaluation results and in consideration of the Company's financial capacity to ensure business sustainability.

The meeting participants also agreed to grant full power and authority to the Board of Commissioners to determine salary or honorarium, allowances, and other facilities for members of the Board of Directors for the 2024 financial year.

# Kebijakan

1. Dewan Komisaris wajib tersebutakan rapat paling kurang 1 (satu) kali dalam 2 (dua) bulan;  
2. Rapat Dewan Komisaris dapat dilangsungkan apabila dihadiri mayoritas dari seluruh anggota Dewan Komisaris;  
3. Dewan Komisaris wajib menjadi rapat bersama Direksi secara Berkala paling kurang 1 (satu) kali dalam 4 (empat) bulan; seda  
4. Kehadiran anggota Dewan Komisaris dalam rapat Dewan Komisaris dan rapat Dewan Komisaris bersama Direksi wajib diungkapkan dalam Laporan Tahunan Perseroan.

Rapat Dewan Komisaris dilaksanan secara berkala, dengan agenda yang mencakup pemantauan kinerja Perseroan, evaluasi strategi, dan pembahasan isu-isupenting terkait governansi korporat serta kepadahan. Dewan Komisaris memimpin rapat dan mengambil keputusan berdasarkan musyawarah untuk mufakat, atasara terbanyak jika tidak tercapai kesepakatan. Hasil rapat bersama Direksi dituangkan dalam risalah rapat, ditandatangani oleh peserta rapat, dan disampaikan kepada seluruh anggota Direksi dan Dewan Komisaris.

# Board of Commissioners Meeting

# Policy

Based on the Board of Commissioners Charter, policies related to Board of Commissioners meetings are described as follows:

1. The Board of Commissioners is required to hold meetings at least 1 (one) time in 2 (two) months;  
2. Board of Commissioners meetings can be held if attended by most of the Board of Commissioners;  
3. The Board of Commissioners is obliged to hold regular meetings with the Board of Directors at least 1 (once) every 4 (four) months; and  
4. The presence of members of the Board of Commissioners at meetings of the Board of Commissioners and meetings of the Board of Commissioners with the Board of Directors must be disclosed in the Company's Annual Report.

Meetings of the Board of Commissioners are held regularly, with agendas covering the monitoring of the Company's performance, evaluation of strategies, and discussion of key issues related to corporate governance and compliance. The Board of Commissioners leads the meetings and makes decisions based on deliberation to reach consensus, or by majority vote if consensus is not achieved. The results of joint meetings with the Board of Directors are documented in minutes of meeting, signed by the meeting participants, and distributed to all members of the Board of Directors and the Board of Commissioners.

# Board of Directors' Meeting

# Policy

Based on the Board of Directors Charter, policies related to the Board of Directors' meetings are described as follows:

1. The Board of Directors is obliged to hold regular Board of Directors meetings at least 1 (one) time every month;  
2. A Board of Directors meeting can be held if attended by a majority of the Board of Directors members;  
3. The Board of Directors is obliged to hold regular meetings of the Board of Directors and the Board of Commissioners at least once every 4 (four) months; and  
4. The presence of members of the Board of Directors at Board of Directors meetings and meetings between the Board of Directors and the Board of Commissioners must be disclosed in the Company's Annual Report.

Board of Directors meetings are held regularly with the aim of evaluating the Company's performance, formulating strategic policies, and discussing key operational and financial issues. The Board of Directors decides by majority vote it a consensus cannot be reached after much discussion and deliberation. Information about the meeting agenda and discussion topics is made public beforehand to ensure the smooth running of the meeting.
